001package io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.registry;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.core.AssertionType;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.core.AssertionTypes;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.functions.AssertionFunctions;
006import java.util.Map;
007import java.util.Objects;
008import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
009import java.util.function.BiPredicate;
010
011/**
012 * Manages the registry of assertion types and their corresponding validation functions.
013 *
014 * <p>This class provides a centralized mechanism for storing and retrieving validation logic
015 * for different assertion types. It supports both built-in and custom assertion types.
016 *
017 * <p>Default assertions include equality checks, string operations, numeric comparisons,
018 * and collection-based validations.
019 *
020 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
021 */
022public final class AssertionRegistry {
023
024   private AssertionRegistry() {
025   }
026
027   private static final Map<AssertionType<?>, BiPredicate<Object, Object>> VALIDATORS = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
028
029   static {
030      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.IS, AssertionFunctions::equals);
031      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.NOT, AssertionFunctions::notEquals);
032      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.CONTAINS, AssertionFunctions::contains);
033      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.NOT_NULL, AssertionFunctions::notNull);
034      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.ALL_NOT_NULL, AssertionFunctions::allNotNull);
035      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.IS_NULL, AssertionFunctions::isNull);
036      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.ALL_NULL, AssertionFunctions::allNull);
037      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.GREATER_THAN, AssertionFunctions::greaterThan);
038      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.LESS_THAN, AssertionFunctions::lessThan);
039      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.CONTAINS_ALL, AssertionFunctions::containsAll);
040      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.CONTAINS_ANY, AssertionFunctions::containsAny);
041      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.STARTS_WITH, AssertionFunctions::startsWith);
042      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.ENDS_WITH, AssertionFunctions::endsWith);
043      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.LENGTH, AssertionFunctions::length);
044      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.MATCHES_REGEX, AssertionFunctions::matchesRegex);
045      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.EMPTY, AssertionFunctions::isEmpty);
046      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.NOT_EMPTY, AssertionFunctions::isNotEmpty);
047      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.BETWEEN, AssertionFunctions::between);
048      VALIDATORS.put(AssertionTypes.EQUALS_IGNORE_CASE, AssertionFunctions::equalsIgnoreCase);
049   }
050
051   /**
052    * Registers a custom assertion type with its corresponding validation function.
053    *
054    * @param type      The custom assertion type to register.
055    * @param validator The validation function that will be used to evaluate this assertion type.
056    * @throws NullPointerException if {@code type} or {@code validator} is null.
057    */
058   public static void registerCustomAssertion(AssertionType<?> type, BiPredicate<Object, Object> validator) {
059      Objects.requireNonNull(type, "AssertionType must not be null");
060      Objects.requireNonNull(validator, "Validator must not be null");
061
062      VALIDATORS.put(type, validator);
063   }
064
065   /**
066    * Retrieves the validation function for a given assertion type.
067    *
068    * @param type The assertion type whose validator should be retrieved.
069    * @return The validation function associated with the specified assertion type.
070    * @throws NullPointerException     if {@code type} is null.
071    * @throws IllegalArgumentException if no validator is registered for the given assertion type.
072    */
073   public static BiPredicate<Object, Object> getValidator(AssertionType<?> type) {
074      Objects.requireNonNull(type, "AssertionType must not be null");
075      BiPredicate<Object, Object> validator = VALIDATORS.get(type);
076
077      if (validator == null) {
078         throw new IllegalArgumentException("No validator registered for AssertionType: " + type.type().name());
079      }
080
081      return validator;
082   }
083
084}
